Course Description: THIS COURSE DEFINES ACCOUNTING OBJECTIVES AND THEIR RELATION TO BUSINESS.  THE STUDENT WILL BE TAUGHT THE FUNDAMENTAL PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING AND WILL BE TRAINED IN THE BOOKKEEPING FUNCTION OF PROPERLY RECORDING TRANSACTIONS IN JOURNALS AND POSTING TO LEDGERS.  THE TRIAL BALANCE, WORKING PAPERS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND COMPLETING AN ACCOUNTING CYCLE ARE INTRODUCED.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.  CLASSIFY ASSETS, LIABILITIES, CAPITAL, REVENUE, AND EXPENSE ACCOUNTS.
2. DIFFERENTIATE BETWEEN DEBITS AND CREDITS.
3. PREPARE A TRIAL BALANCE, WORKSHEET AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
4. ANALYZE DATA FOR ADJUSTING ENTRIES.
5. COMPARE ACCOUNTING PROCEDURES FOR A SERVICE AND MERCHANDISING 
               ENTERPRISE.
6. DEMONSTRATE AN ABILITY TO COMPLETE THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE BY COMPLETING
    A COMPREHENSIVE PROBLEM.
Textbook(s):
ACCOUNTING 22E, WARREN, REEVE, DUCHAC, 2007 THOMSON LEARNING ISBN 0324401841 

WORKING PAPERS CHAPTERS 1-17, THOMSON LEARNING, ISBN: 0-324-38262-6
